document.masterDocTitle: Torrenticolid water mites (Acari: Hydrachnidia: Torrenticolidae) from Ghana

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Torrenticolid water mites (Acari: Hydrachnidia: Torrenticolidae) from Ghana

subSubSection.paragraph:
New records . Ghana : Supon stream near Asiakwa, Atewa Hills, 6 º
15.530 N
, 0º
30.642 W
, alt. 250 m asl.,
7 .iii. 2011
, Smit, 0/ 1 /0 (mounted); Small rainforest stream upstream Sagyimase, Atewa Hills, 6 º
13.964 N
, 0º
33.116 W
, alt. 654 m asl.,
8 .iii. 2011
, Smit, 0/ 1 [juvenile]/0 (mounted); Apkonu stream, downstream of falls, Logba Tata, 6 º
53.054 N
, 0º
28.024 E
, alt. 362 m asl.,
21 .ii. 2013
, Smit, 0/ 1 /0.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 22A–G.
Monatractides stigeophora (Cook, 1966)
, female (A–B, D–G = from Supon stream, C = from Apkonu stream): A = dorsal shield; B = idiosoma, ventral view; C = frontal margin of idiosoma, dorsal view; D = palp, medial view; E = palp, lateral view; F = I-L-5 and -6; G = gnathosoma and chelicera. Scale bars = 100 Μm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Measurements (from Supon stream, in parentheses juvenile specimen [indicated by weak sclerotization and caudal position of excretory pore, see
Figs. 25 G
,
26 G
] from stream upstream Sagyimase)—Idiosoma (ventral view:
Figs. 22 B
,
26 F
) L 738 ( 595 ), W 463 ( 418 ); dorsal shield (
Figs. 22 A
,
25 F
) L 628 ( 541 ), W 395 ( 372 ), L/W ratio 1.59 ( 1.45 ); dorsal plate L 594 ( 506 ); shoulder platelets L 150 ( 168–172 ), W 56 ( 50 ), L/W ratio 2.7 ( 3.4 ); frontal platelets L 119–122 ( 125 ), W 48–50 ( 47–50 ), L/W ratio 2.44–2.45 ( 2.5–2.66 ); shoulder/frontal plate L ratio 1.23–1.26 ( 1.34–1.38 ). Gnathosomal bay L 153 ( 167 ), Cx-I total L 272 ( 272 ), Cx-I mL 119 ( 105 ), Cx-II+III mL 46 ( 51 ); ratio Cx-I L/Cx-II+III mL 5.9 ( 5.3 ); Cx-I mL/Cx-II+III mL 2.6 ( 2.1 ). Genital field L/W 164 ( 155 )/ 141 ( 136 ), ratio 1.16 ( 1.14 ); distance genital field-excretory pore 184 , genital field-caudal idiosoma margin 256 . Gnathosoma vL 192 ; chelicera total L 260 ( 262 ), basal segment L 155–160 ( 166 ), claw L 103–105 ( 99 ); palp total L 195–198 ( 199 ), dL/H, dL/H ratio: P-1, 28/ 28 , 1.0 ( 29 / 32 , 0.91 ); P-2, 61– 62 / 51 , 1.2 ( 66 / 49 , 1.34 ); P-3, 38– 39 / 43 , 0.89 ( 37 / 41 , 0.9 ); P-4, 47/ 31 , 1.53 ( 46 / 29 , 1.58 ); P-5, 21– 22 / 15 , 1.5 ( 21 / 15 , 1.34 ); P- 2 /P- 4 ratio 1.31 ( 1.43 ); dL of I-L: 51, 60, 66 ( 65 ), 77 ( 77 ), 83 ( 80 ), 92 ( 89 ); I-L- 6 H 48 ( 46 ), dL/H I-L- 6 ratio 1.93 ( 1.93 ).

Remarks . The specimens from Ghana agree well in general morphology with
Monatractides stigeophora (
Cook, 1966
)
, a species described by
Cook ( 1966 )
based on a single female from a stream in Liberia . Within the genus,
Monatractides ( M. ) stigeophora (
Cook, 1966
)
( Liberia ),
M. ( M. ) neostigeophora (
Cook, 1966
)
( Liberia ,
Cook 1966
), and
M. ( M. ) falcifera (
K.O. Viets, 1974
)
( Congo ,
K.O. Viets & Böttger 1974
) form a group of similar species, the “
stigeophora
species group“. This group is characterized by a pointed, protruding gnathosomal rostrum and chelicera with a long, needle-like claw.
